3: Hmm...?
Commandant?

2: How do you know it's me?

3: I've long remembered the sound of your footsteps! Of course I know it's you.

2: Always with your jokes. How are you doing?

3: Much better, thanks to all of you. Check this out—
HEE—HA—HO—
Good as new!

2: You do look like your usual lively self.

3: Hehe, didn't I tell you the almighty Kamui will be back in no time? See, I wasn't lying!
Absolutely! You can check the data on the Maintenance Chamber if you want.
I'll never lie to you.
—You're Commandant, after all.
By the way, are you here by yourself, Commandant?
That's great!
Nothing. It's just that...
There's something important I want to tell you.

4: It's not... what I think it is, is it?

3: You knew, Commandant!

2: I've known you for a while, after all.

3: So, what would you do if it was you, Commandant?
...If there was another you in the world.

2: It... must be confusing, isn't it?

3: Even for Construct?

4: To me, you're all unique individuals. You're all alive.

3: Is that why it'd confuse you, Commandant? Because you wouldn't be unique anymore?

2: But I'm sure I would want to talk to the other me eventually.

3: Is that so... Thank you, Commandant.
Huh? Do you know what I want to say already?
Ah! You lied!
And here I thought you already got me all figured out.
Oh? Does that mean you want to know more about me, Commandant?

2: It'd help us work together better, for sure.

3: Hahaha! I was just kidding. You really don't stop thinking about tactics and plans.

2: So, what was it that you were trying to say?

3: You know... Just something impractical. The future.
See, we're fighting because we want to reclaim Earth, right?
Then, say, if that day does arrive...
How will our lives change?
Have you not thought about it, Commandant? Once the war is over, we won't have these packed schedules and daily routines anymore.
We'll have so much free time to do what we want to do, to go where we want to go.
What will you want to do, Commandant?
I really care about this. I want to know.
...I am. I knew I couldn't fool you.
We were made only to take back the home of humans.
And when we do, we will no longer have any purpose...
What?

2: I didn't think you would ask something so... sentimental.

3: That doesn't sound like me, does it? Maybe I've spent too much time with you, Commandant, and I care about more things now.

2: That's good. That means your M.I.N.D. is getting more stable.

3: Hehe, I feel like I've just been babbling nonstop. I hope you don't mind, Commandant.
See? I knew it. You're the best!
Huh?

2: I don't know the answer now, that's true.
But I'll be searching for it. With you.

3: Then that's a promise!
(Chuckles)
Commandant...
I might be part of the Strike Hawks...
But I won't stop fighting for that future of yours.
